# Getting Help with LLM Council

Need help? Here are your options:

## Documentation

Start with the documentation:

- **[README](README.md)** - Installation, setup, and usage
- **[CLAUDE.md](CLAUDE.md)** - Technical architecture and implementation details
- **[Architecture Decision Records](docs/adr/)** - Design decisions and rationale

## Community Support

### GitHub Discussions

For questions, ideas, and community conversation:

- **[Q&A](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/discussions/categories/q-a)** - Ask questions and get help
- **[Ideas](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/discussions/categories/ideas)** - Suggest new features
- **[Show and Tell](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/discussions/categories/show-and-tell)** - Share your projects

### Discord

Join our Discord server for real-time chat:

- **[LLM Council Discord](https://discord.gg/y467DGHF)** - Real-time community chat

## Bug Reports and Feature Requests

### Found a Bug?

1. Search [existing issues](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/issues) first
2. If not found, [create a new issue](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/issues/new?template=bug_report.md)
3. Include:
   - Version (`pip show llm-council-core`)
   - Python version
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Expected vs actual behavior

### Want a Feature?

1. Check [existing feature requests](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/issues?q=label%3Aenhancement)
2. Open a [feature request](https://github.com/amiable-dev/llm-council/issues/new?template=feature_request.md)
3. Describe the use case and expected behavior

## Security Issues

**Do not open public issues for security vulnerabilities.**

See [SECURITY.md](SECURITY.md) for responsible disclosure instructions.

## Contributing

Want to contribute? See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for:

- Development setup
- Coding standards
- Pull request process

## Commercial Support

For enterprise support, custom integrations, or consulting:

- Contact: enterprise@amiable.dev

## Response Times

| Channel | Expected Response |
|---------|------------------|
| GitHub Discussions | 1-3 days |
| GitHub Issues (bugs) | 1-7 days |
| Security Reports | 48 hours |

*Note: This is an open-source project maintained by volunteers. Response times may vary.*
